meanings.definition: The front surface of a coal seam.
meanings.sent1: Miners use tools to extract coal from the coalfaces.
meanings.sent2: The workers were covered in dust after a long day at the coalfaces.
meanings.sent3: Why did the coal seam break up with the coalfaces? They couldn't handle the pressure!
meanings.sent4: The coalfaces of the mine stared back at the miners, dark and unyielding.
meanings.sent5: The coalfaces loomed ahead, a daunting task for the miners.

meanings.sent1: Miners coalfaces diligently to extract the coal.
meanings.sent2: She coalfaces every day to provide for her family.
meanings.sent3: The team decided to coalfaces together to finish the job faster.
meanings.sent4: He coalfaces with determination, knowing the importance of his work.
meanings.sent5: Coalfacing requires strength and skill to be successful.

meanings.sent1: The miners gathered at the entrance to the coalface of the mine.
meanings.sent2: Exploring the dark tunnels, they finally reached the coalface of the mine.
meanings.sent3: The coalface of the mine seemed to whisper secrets to those who listened closely.
meanings.sent4: The coalface of the mine was like a giant puzzle waiting to be solved.
meanings.sent5: The miners' safety lamps flickered as they approached the coalface of the mine.
